intro: Hedyotis fluviatilis f. kamapuaana, commonly known as the Kama'pua'anu or the Hawaiian water geranium, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its small, delicate flowers and trailing growth habit. The plant typically grows in wet, shaded areas such as stream banks and forest floors. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy appearance. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting local insect populations and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian wetlands.
